markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 17"
    pfs=""
>
[Spellcutter](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1457)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Cursed" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=274" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star](/Sources.aspx?ID=103) pg. 76</row>

**Price** 15,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Longsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=31)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The blade of this _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [adamantine](/Equipment.aspx?ID=374) [longsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=31)_ seems to absorb light from the air around it, giving the impression the wielder is standing in the shadow of a much larger creature. While _Spellcutter_ is a potent weapon for battling [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) and [constructs](/Traits.aspx?ID=35), an ancient restriction on the blade prevents it from harming living creatures; attacks against living beings deal no damage. This restriction doesn't apply to [dhampirs](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=23) or creatures with the [negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42) ability who are otherwise living; the magic of the blade can't distinguish between such beings and undead.

<document level="2" id="action-1101" />

<document level="2" id="action-1102" />

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Spellcutter
